## Page 1

ASSESSA
INDÚSTRIA, COMÉRCIO E EXPORTAÇÃO LTDA.
TECHNICAL BULLETIN
ACTIMULSI GA 20
A NEW MULTIFUNCTIONAL BIOACTIVE FOR MORE EFFECTIVE AND NATURAL COSMETICS FORMULATION
INCI Name: Acacia Senegal Gum Extract
Plants have evolved sophisticated innate immune
system during long period evolution against
pathogens. Pathogen-associated molecular pattern
(PAMP)-triggered immunity (PTI) serves as a
primary plant defense response against microbial
pathogens, while plant Resistance (R) proteins can
recognize pathogen effectors to initiate a stronger
defense mechanism, termed effector-triggered
immunity (ETI). Part of the pathogen-associated
molecular pattern (PAMP) immune system of the
plant is based in the production of an exudate,
which acts as a chemical barrier, preventing attacks
by pathogens and allowing for the recovery of the
plant tissue.
This exsudate is mostly composed of
heteropolysaccharides with a complex structure,
with different sugars such as arabinose, galactose,
glucose, rhamnose, xylose and uronic acids that
form a sophisticated polymeric structure with unique
properties.
The Acacia senegal is a species of leguminous
genus Acacia native to semi-desert regions of Sub-
Saharan Africa.
When subjected to attacks by microorganisms,
environmental stress or suffer any physical damage,
Acacia senegal exudes a gum that protects and
helps the plant in its regeneration.
ACTIMULSI GA 20 is a new ingredient,
extracted from the exsudate of Acacia Senegal.
ACTIMULSI GA 20 is a branched
heteropolysaccharide (acid arabinogalactan)
containing approximately 70% of galactose
and 12% of glucose, rhamnose, xylose and
uronic acids. ACTIMULSI GA 20 also contains
other defense-related molecules from the
secondary metabolism of the plant.
Due to its structural characteristics,
ACTIMULSI GA 20 acts as a co-emulsifying
natural agent.
EFFECT OF EMULSIFIERS ON THE SKIN
Emulsifiers can damage the skin barrier by
emulsifying the intercellular lipids and disrupting the
lipid bilayer, increasing TEWL and impairing the
protective function of the skin.

EVALUATION OF THE STABILITY OF
EMULSIONS THROUGH THE ANALYSIS OF
MICELLES
Computational analysis of the distribution of
micelles by size over time is a good method for
evaluating the stability of an emulsion
(See Figure 1).
Micelles in less stable emulsions show a
tendency to coalescence, but in stable
emulsions they remain unchanged.
Coalescence
(grouping) of
micelles
Different
diameters of
micelles
Figure 1
1

## Page 2

The effect of ACTIMULSI GA20 on the stability of an
emulsion was tested. A formula (Control Formula -
CF) containing 2.75% Laureth-23 as a co-emulsifier
was compared with a test formula (Test Formula -
TF) containing 1% of ACTIMULSI GA20, where the
emulsifier concentration was reduced to 1%. The
stability of both formulas was evaluated over 23 days
using computational analysis (a proprietary program
developed over a MATLAB™ platform).
Results are seen below
Graphs 1 and 2 below show the distribution of
micelles in the emulsions of control formula
(CF) and test formula (TF1), after 2 and 23 days.

1%Laureth-23 shows the decrease of the

Analysis of the results show that the micelles
in the test formula, containing only 1%
emulsifier (Laureth-23) are more stable over
time than the control formula (CF) containing
2,75% Laureth-23. The use of ACTIMULSI GA
20 into the test emulsion also allowed for the
reduction of Laureth-23 by 63.6% without loss
of stability.
ANALYSIS OF THE MORPHOLOGY OF
MICELLES
Similarly to the analysis of the stability of
emulsions, the computational analysis of the
morphology of the micelles is a good indicator of
the sensory attributes of an emulsion.
Emulsions formed by spherical-shaped micelles
generally have better sensory attributes when
compared to emulsions formed by odd-shaped
micelles.
Thus, the effect of ACTIMULSI GA20 on the shape
of the micelles in an emulsion was tested. A formula
(Control Formula - CF) containing 2.75% Laureth-23
as a co-emulsifier was compared with a test formula
(Test Formula- TF) containing 1% of ACTIMULSI GA
20, where the emulsifier concentration was reduced to
1%. The analysis of the shape of both formulas was
evaluated using computational analysis (a proprietary
program developed over a MATLAB™ platform).
Results are seen below.
Graphs 3 and 4 below show the distribution of
micelles accordingly to their shape (circularity
/sphericity) in the control formula (CF) and test
formula (TF2).

Test formula with ACTIMULSI GA20 + 1%
Laureth-23 shows a better sphericity, with 90% of
the micelles in the optimum range, while the control
formula showed only 70% of the micelles in the
ideal range of circularity/shpericity.
The increase in the average sphericity of the
micelles in the test formula leads to a better skin
feel of the emulsion. Comparative tests performed
with both formulas showed a clear preference of
the panelists for the test formula (TF2), reaching
high scores of "smooth" and "silk touch" and
"good preadability" attributes.

ANTI-INFLAMMATORY ACTIVITY
Evaluated by TNF-a release fom macrophage
culture stimulated with LPS. Macrophages were
incubated for 1 hour in the presence of test
compound. After this period, the cells were
stimulated with LPS (100 ng / ml) for 24 h.
Supernatant was collected and subjected to
cytokine quantification by ELISA.

ACTIMUSI GA20 is not toxic to

ACTIMULSI GA20 is a natural plant-
derived bioactive that combines the ability
of stabilizing emulsions with an intense
biological activity, promoting the
regeneration of the skin and stimulating
the synthesis of collagen I and III.
The use of ACTIMULSI GA20 in
emulsion formulas also improves the
product's sensory attributes, adding a
pleasant dry / silky feeling to the skin.
ACTIMULSI GA20 is a perfect choice
for a "greener formula", reducing the need of
ethoxylated emulsifiers in cosmetic
formulas, while keeping them stable and
safe.
Recommendations for use

gpt_manufacturer_or_supplier_answer: ASSESSESA INDÚSTRIA, COMÉRCIO E EXPORTAÇÃO LTDA.
gpt_manufacturer_or_supplier_reason: The document is a technical bulletin for ACTIMULSI GA 20 issued by ASSESSESA INDÚSTRIA, COMÉRCIO E EXPORTAÇÃO LTDA., which is prominently mentioned at the top of the first page and contact details are provided at the bottom of the third page, indicating they are the manufacturer or supplier of ACTIMULSI GA 20.
gpt_select_industry_cluster_reason: Selected Personal Care because the document explicitly mentions ACTIMULSI GA 20's use in moisturizing creams, lotions, anti-ageing emulsions, night creams, and serums for the scalp, all of which are personal care products. The product's benefits such as skin barrier protection, anti-inflammatory activity, collagen stimulation, and improved sensory attributes further confirm its relevance to Personal Care. There is no mention of use in Homecare or Institutional Cleaning products.
gpt_select_compositions_reason: Selected Derived Natural and Vegetal because the product is described as an extract from Acacia Senegal gum, a natural plant exudate, indicating vegetal origin and derived natural substances. No mention of biomolecules from microorganisms, minerals, or synthetic substances.
gpt_select_functions_reason: Selected Active because of the demonstrated anti-inflammatory activity reducing TNF-α production by 24.7%. Selected Co-Emulsifier and Emulsifier because ACTIMULSI GA 20 acts as a co-emulsifying natural agent and allows reduction of Laureth-23 while maintaining emulsion stability. Selected Stabilizer due to improved micelle size distribution and morphology indicating better emulsion stability. Selected Skin Sensory Additive because it improves sensory attributes such as smoothness, silk touch, and spreadability as preferred by panelists. Other functions were not selected as there is no mention or evidence in the document supporting those roles.
gpt_select_applications_reason: Selected Skin Care because the document mentions ACTIMULSI GA 20 promotes skin regeneration, stimulates collagen synthesis, protects the skin barrier, and is recommended for moisturizing creams, lotions, anti-ageing emulsions, and night creams. Selected Hair Care because the product is recommended for use in serums for the scalp, indicating relevance to hair care applications.
gpt_cas_from_doc_reason: The document provides detailed information about ACTIMULSI GA 20, including its INCI name (Acacia Senegal Gum Extract), composition, biological properties, and usage recommendations, but does not mention any CAS Registry Number.
gpt_physical_form_reason: Selected Powder because the document describes ACTIMULSI GA 20 as an extract from Acacia Senegal gum, which is typically processed and supplied as a powder form for cosmetic ingredient use.
gpt_gen_product_description: ACTIMULSI GA 20 is a multifunctional bioactive ingredient derived from Acacia Senegal gum, composed mainly of branched heteropolysaccharides including galactose and glucose. It acts as a natural co-emulsifier, enhancing emulsion stability while reducing the need for synthetic emulsifiers. This ingredient supports skin barrier protection, promotes collagen synthesis, and offers anti-inflammatory benefits, making it ideal for moisturizing and anti-aging cosmetic formulations.
gpt_recommended_dosage_answer: Moisturizing creams: 1.0 to 2.0%; Moisturizing lotions: 1.5 to 3.0%; Anti-ageing emulsions: 1.5 to 3.0%; Night creams: 1.5 to 3.0%; Serums for the scalp: 1.5 to 3.0%
gpt_recommended_dosage_reason: Dosage is given in the 'Recommendations for Use' section specifying recommended concentration ranges for different product types in the document.
gpt_certifications_reason: No certifications related to ACTIMULSI GA 20 or the manufacturer ASSESSESA INDÚSTRIA, COMÉRCIO E EXPORTAÇÃO LTDA. are mentioned in the provided document.
gpt_claims_reason: Selected Anti-Aging and Anti-Wrinkle because the product is recommended for anti-ageing emulsions and stimulates collagen I and III synthesis. Selected Anti-Inflammatory because it reduces TNF-α production by 24.7% in macrophages. Selected Moisturizing, Nourishing, Skin Barrier Function, Skin Renewal, Skin Repair, and Smoothing because the product promotes skin regeneration, protects the skin barrier by reducing ethoxylated emulsifiers, and improves sensory attributes such as smoothness and silk touch. Selected Natural Cosmetic because it is a natural extract from Acacia Senegal gum. Selected Texturizer because it improves emulsion stability and sensory attributes like spreadability and dry/silky feeling. Other claims are not supported by the document.
gpt_health_benefits_reason: Only applicable for FBI business line
